author: Richard

text: This is probably my favorite song ever. I've heard thousands of different songs of every genre, whether they be symphony, video game, rock... This is my favorite. When I listen to this, I know everything's going to be all right. I can close my eyes and recall old summer days... playing on the rocky beach near grandma's seaside cabin, the setting sun casting a warm glow on the trees... aw man, good times.

author: Alberto Perillo

text:
Memories of the first steps
Memories of the first mine
Memories of the first craft
Memories of Alpha
Memories of see-through trees
Memories of the bright sunny lands
Memories of bright, green grass
Memories of White, woolen blocks
Memories in the form of a song
Memories...

Oh how you've grown...

author: mattadrag

text: @geoalpha You create more tools from the materials you find while mining and build a house. You expand it to a castle, fighting off Zombies, Creepers and Skeletons in the night to defend what you have created so far. Time to time you visit the old mines and see where you have started, minining a little deeper into the old caves that are lit up in a gently manner by torches.
author: Eivuiee

text: I like hearing this song when night falls and I'm sitting in my shelter with my light and watching the skies...
author: Grimsteel

text:
@Zephryion  I couldn't agree more, though not on Angry Birds.
Minecraft is a genuine gamer's fantasy brought to life, you can do anything you want to. And for what you can't, well, there are mods a plenty to play around with. Try the Aether or Fairy mods if you get the game, but stay away from MC Edit or TooManyItems if you want to build and play by thy own hand alone.
author: Sparkbomber

text:
Minecraft really is quite special...and so is the music. The songs don't play very often ingame but I never had a situation where a song didn't improve my feelings in a situation. Like once where I was just hiding because of rain, one of these songs played and yeah...it's like reallife just without getting wet
nerdy words x_X

text: Wow, this song already feels nostalgic to me... I played minecraft back in august last year... So many memories of playing on Freebuild Flatlands, when I got accepted as an operator, now I own my own server.

author: quizr

text: @SupraDarky One of the most memorable moments I have with this song is being stuck on top of a tree with mobs (enemies) on the beach below, my fortress a bit too far to get to, and dangerous on top of a hill. It started playing just before the sun was rising, and it was such a peaceful moment that got me reflecting about a lot. Despite being a poorly texturized sun, it was one of the most beautiful moments the game ever presented for me. If I can recommend any game to you, Supra, it's this one.

author: Oscar Ge

text: Kewl picture. :3
author: Jokerfaic

text: This song brings so much back, when I hear it I remember that first world Like I made it yesterday. I feel so close and yet so far from feeling that day again. I start worlds to try again, but now I know what to do. I know where to go, what to craft, and when. I remember when I was scared to go past a few mountains on my base, but now I know it's just going to be more stuff. Still, I don't want to be sad about something I like. The fact that I got to experenice that makes me really happy.
author: videobun

text: It's kind of silly to talk about the way minceraft "used to be", but I can't help but feel sad knowing I will never feel the same way I had when I first started playing this game. I played the creative mode for hours a day, even staying up all night to work on a building. I finally bought the game, and I remebmer the first cave I found, when I moved into another cave, and the first time hearing skeletons burning outside. It's not the same. That file is gone, and I can never relive it when I try.
author: videobun

text: @SupraDarky Sweet, I was just listening to this song on LovelyVGM's channel earlier today.
author: VGChampion

text:
It's creative games like this that make me wish I was a PC Gamer(it's not that I'm unwilling so much as playing with mouse and keyboard just feels awkward to me).
Also have to wonder with the game builders out there why we have yet to see RPG Maker 4 on current gen, let alone game builders for shooters, 3D platformers, or a well fleshed out fighter maker(unlike Agetec's attempts). LBP is great, but it'd be great to have more game building games from big companies.

text: That feeling when you're in a cave system, picking away at stone. This song starts to play... You turn around, look off into the dark distance. text: I haven't played this game, but I know I'd like it. The soundtrack is certainly lovely and for those who like it, I recommend buying it for only 4 dollars (the link is in the description).
